{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3153338,"name":"Shawn","username":"chonkrdoggr","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/13edae/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-02-26T23:48:26.972Z","cooked":"

Is there a way to connect a Limelight camera and a USB camera connected to a Raspberry Pi on the same robot, or is this not possible?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2023-02-26T23:59:34.338Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":98,"reads":122,"readers_count":121,"score":514.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":428223,"topic_slug":"can-you-use-a-limelight-camera-and-a-usb-camera-connected-to-a-rasp-pi-on-1-robot","display_username":"Shawn","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57565,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/can-you-use-a-limelight-camera-and-a-usb-camera-connected-to-a-rasp-pi-on-1-robot/428223/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3153342,"name":"","username":"Autumn-Ou","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/autumn-ou/{size}/192598_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-27T00:02:19.656Z","cooked":"

Throw a network switch on your bot and it’s fine you might need to do a bit of network management but multidevice systems for camera feeds, april tags, & ML are able to function together and push to the network tables all together.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2023-02-27T00:02:19.656Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":119,"readers_count":118,"score":48.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":428223,"topic_slug":"can-you-use-a-limelight-camera-and-a-usb-camera-connected-to-a-rasp-pi-on-1-robot","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56369,"hidden":false,"trust_level":0,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Making funky products"},"user_suspended":true,"post_url":"/t/can-you-use-a-limelight-camera-and-a-usb-camera-connected-to-a-rasp-pi-on-1-robot/428223/2","custom_user_title":"Making funky products","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3153349,"name":"Christian Femia","username":"ChristianFemia","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/christianfemia/{size}/172343_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-27T00:21:15.768Z","cooked":"

If your goal is to just have the USB camera as a secondary camera, you can plug in the USB camera into the Limelight’s USB port. Now, if you want to run ML on your rPi, then a Network switch would be the better option.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2023-02-27T00:21:15.768Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":107,"readers_count":106,"score":41.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":428223,"topic_slug":"can-you-use-a-limelight-camera-and-a-usb-camera-connected-to-a-rasp-pi-on-1-robot","display_username":"Christian Femia","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://docs.limelightvision.io/en/latest/frequently_asked_questions.html?highlight=USB#why-is-there-an-extra-usb-port","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Frequently Asked Questions — Limelight 1.0 documentation","clicks":21}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":45546,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/can-you-use-a-limelight-camera-and-a-usb-camera-connected-to-a-rasp-pi-on-1-robot/428223/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3153505,"name":"Leo","username":"leo-les","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/leo-les/{size}/172390_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-27T05:19:00.153Z","cooked":"

You can do it, but you should buy one of these to do network management

amazon.com

Amazon.com: Brainboxes Switch - 5 Ports - DIN Rail mountable (SW-005) :...

Amazon.com: Brainboxes Switch - 5 Ports - DIN Rail mountable (SW-005) : Electronics
